item.title: Check armor/weapons
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

[quote=“WowILikeToCode, post:5, topic:416912”]Why are you trying to do this, Wouldn’t it be easier to just check if player has items before they use a function for example?

playerEquipment[playerHat] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerCape] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerAmulet] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerArrows] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerChest] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerLegs] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerHands] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerFeet] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerRing] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerWeapon] >= -1; playerEquipment[playerShield] >= -1;

What that would do is if the player is wearing an item which value is greater than -1 it doesn’t allow them to do a function[/quote]
-1 means they are wearing nothing… all you did was change == to >= which doesn’t change anything as you can’t even go below -1.

Read full topic

item.title: Check armor/weapons
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

I’m trying to create a method to check if the player is wearing nothing… I’m fairly new to java programming so don’t make fun please.

This is what I’ve got:

public void noPlayerEquipment() { playerEquipment[playerHat] == -1; playerEquipment[playerCape] == -1; playerEquipment[playerAmulet] == -1; playerEquipment[playerArrows] == -1; playerEquipment[playerChest] == -1; playerEquipment[playerLegs] == -1; playerEquipment[playerHands] == -1; playerEquipment[playerFeet] == -1; playerEquipment[playerRing] == -1; playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == -1; playerEquipment[playerShield] == -1; }

Comes up with “== is not a statement” errors though.

Read full topic
